sentences.sContent: They moved to a new house some time ago (=  a fairly long time ago  ) .
sentences.sCn: 他们搬进新居已有些日子了。

sentences.sContent: We had our bicentenary celebrations not that long ago.
sentences.sCn: 不久前，我们举行了200周年庆典活动。

sentences.sContent: ...What Barth wrote decades ago is even truer today...
...Years ago the government made money by selling public lands...
...Should a woman who possessed a small amount of drugs years ago be permanently unable to be licensed as a nurse...
...ended four years ago when his employer went out of business...
...Tradition has it that an ancient Chinese emperor discovered the tea five thousand years ago and used it to treat illnesses...
...I decided to give the voluntary sector ago and was surprised to be offered flexible working conditions and other solutions to meet my needs as an employee...
...She was injured in a car accident two weeks ago and still in critical condition...
...Some years ago I was offered a writing assignment that would require three months of travel through Europe...
...Two months ago Gullotta saw a 50-year-old ma who had delayed doing anything about his smoker’s cough for a year...

trans.tranOther: used to show how far back in the past something happened
